title.narrative: LITERACY AND NON-FORMAL EDUCATION

description.narrative: Out of school children accessing Non-Formal Education are integrated into formal education at national level and in select provinces by 2017., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, policies and programmes to achieve inclusive universal basic education, holistic ECCD and alternative pathways to learning are in place and effectively implemented by Department of Education and Department of Community Development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Out of school children accessing Non-Formal Education are integrated into formal education at national level and in selectprovinces by 2017.

description.narrative: NDoE has produced a draft National Report on Out of School Children, which includes information on barriers and bottlenecks, inhibiting their access to school. An additional one thousand out of school children are accessing flexible and alternative learning opportunities and continuing their education | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2017
